shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Collection of psalms (fols. 2ra, l.1 – 4vb, l.19). Includes Pss. 25, 29, 60, 101, 129, 130; (fols. 158vb, l.13 – 159va, l.11) Pss. 140, 142 II) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 4ra, l.1 – 22ra, l.19) III) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Order of the Mass” (fols. 22ra, l.20 – 51va, l.17) IV) Anaphoras (fols. 51va – 146vb) IV-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 51va, l.18 – 65va, l.12) IV-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 65va, l.13 – 69va, l.2) IV-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 69va, l.3 – 79rb, l.6) IV-4) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 79rb, l.10 – 87va, l.12) IV-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 87va, l.16 – 95rb, l.3) IV-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 95rb, l.6 – 105rb, l.13) IV-7) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 105rb, l.15 – 119rb, l.15) IV-8) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 119rb, l.18 – 125vb, l.3) IV-9) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 125vb, l.6 – 130va, l.18) IV-10) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 130va, l.20 – 136rb, l.12) IV-11) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 136rb, l.15 – 138rb, l.13) IV-12) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 138rb, l.18 – 144ra, l.9) IV-13) The second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 144ra, l.11 – 146vb, l.10) V) Ṣälotä ʿǝṭan zä-gǝbʾatä mänṭolaʿǝt “The Prayer of Incense while Entering behind the Curtain” (fols. 146vb, l.11 – 156vb, l.8) VI) Śǝrˤatä betä krǝstiyan “The Order of the Church” (fols. 157ra, l.1 – 158rb, l.14)
Additiones 1-4.

owners.owner: ʾabunä ʾAbä Lodis and his son Wäldä Giyorgis (s. Additio 2).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(3; s. l.: 1, stub after 3/fols. 1r-3v) – ፩I(10/fols. 4r-13v) – ፪II(10/fols. 14r-23v) – ፫III(10/fols. 24r-33v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 34r-43v) – ፭V(10/fols. 44r-53v) – ፮VI(10; stub after 2/fols. 54r-63v) – ፯VII(10/fols. 64r-73v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 74r-83v) – ፱IX(10/fols. 84r-93v) – ፲X(10/fols. 94r-103v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 104r-113v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 114r-123v) – ፲፫XIII(10/fols. 124r-133v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 134r-141v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 142r-149v) – ፲፮XVI(10/fols. 150r-159v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 115r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 98r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Careful, regular, by a well-trained hand.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; incipits of texts or parts of texts (mostly alternately in red and black lines); directives for the ministers; እገሌ፡ standing for the name of the reigning king; some of the abbreviations; part of the notation signs above the lines; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numerals.
The text in fols. 4r and 157ra (upper part) is written alternately in red and black lines. Calendar notes at the beginning of the respective Anaphoras are written in alternating red and black letters.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሆ(ሣ)፡ ሆ፡ ሆ፡ for ሆሣዕና፡ ሆሣዕና፡ ሆሣዕና፡ ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ ንስ፡ እግ፡ ወና፡ በእ፡ for ንስእለከ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወናስተበቊዓከ፡ በእንተ፡ ይት፡ ወይ፡ (እኩ፡ ወስ፡) ስሙ፡ ለእ፡ or የ፡ ወ፡ እ፡ ወ፡ ስ፡ ለ፡ for ይትአኰት፡ ወይሴባሕ፡ (እኩት፡ ወስቡሕ፡) ስሙ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ማ(ለ)፡ ነ፡ for ማለት፡ ነው፡ (in Text VI) ማ፡ for ማለት፡ (in Text VI)

otherdetails.otherdetail:
It is not clear if text I is a guest-text added at some point after the main text was written, or if the respective folios originate from a different manuscripts, and were reutilized for AQG-012.
Blue thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 26v for navigation in the text. Text VI is written in compressed script, by the same hand as the rest of the Ms.

additional.add: Fol. 3v: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘዓዲ፡ ቆልቋል፡ ዘተሣየጥዋ፡ በ፲ወ፰፡ ብሩር፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ውእቱ፡ በዘመነ፡ ቄስ፡ አበለዲስ፡ ወጨቃውን[sic]፡ ብላታ፡ ሸቊላብ፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ሹመ፡ ነጋሪቱን፡ ትግሬ፡ መኰኒ፡ ደረስ። ወታቦትኒ፡ ኻለኛ፡ በዘመነ፡ አቡነ፡ አትናቴዎስ፡ ተባረከ፡ ወገበዙኒ፡ ቄስ፡ ወልደ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ዋጋው፡ [፭]። ብር፡ ነው፡ በይእቲ፡ ዕለት፡ ዘተገብረ፡ ሲሳይ፡ ዘቄስ፡ ወልደ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጭቃውን፡ ብላታ፡ ሙሴ፡ ነበሩ፡ ዘሠረቃ፡ ወዘፈሐቋ[sic]፡ በቃለ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን።
additional.tran: Fol. 3v: This is the book of ˁAddi Qolqwal which they bought for 18 silver (Thalers?), of (the church of) St. George, in the time of the priest ˀAbälädis, while ḉəqa was blatta Säqwəlab, in the time of King Yoḥannəs, the governor of his drum being up to Təgray, Mähwänni. And the second (?) tabot was consecrated in the time of ˀabunä ˀAtnatewos, and gäbäz was priest Wäldä Krəstos. Its price was 5 Bərr. The meal prepared on this day is of priest Wäldä Krəstos, while ḉəqa was blatta Muse. THe one who stole is erased (its text) will be excommunicated by the word of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: Written in a mixture of Gǝˤǝz and Amharic. The first mention of the name of the priest Wäldä Krǝstos has been deleted, only the last letters are readable.

additional.add: Fol. 158rb: በስ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሐሉ፡ ምስለ {ገብ}አቡነ፡ አበ፡ ሎዲስ፡ ወውልዱ[sic]፡ ወልደ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡
additional.tran: Fol. 158rb: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God, may His blessing and His benediction rest with His servant ˀabunä ˀAbä Lodis and his son Wäldä Giyorgis.

additional.add: Fol. 159va: መጽሐፈ፡ ጊዮርጊስ ሰማእት፡ ዝውእቱ፡ አድ፡ ቊልቋል፡ ዘፈሐቃ፡ ወዘሰረቃ፡ ው{ግ}ግዝ ይኩን፡ ለአለመ፡ አለም
additional.tran: Fol. 159va: The book of (the church of) George the martyr, which is ˀAd Qwǝlqwal. Anyone who has deleted (it's text) or stolen it shall be excommunicated forever and ever.

additional.cont: Fol. 158va-vb: Note mentioning various liturgical prayers and actions to be learned by a priest.

extras.extra: - Fols. 1r, 1v: Writing exercises. - Fol. 61v (in the upper margin): Note. - Fol. 156v (in the bottom margin): Crude note, naming one of the owners of the Ms. (?).

frames.frame: - Fol. 15va: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 20vb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 22ra: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 51va: Coloured ornamental band. - Fol. 65va: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 69va: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 79rb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 87va: Coloured ornamental band. - Fol. 95rb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 105rb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 105rb: Coloured ornamental band. - Fol. 113va: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 119rb: Coloured ornamental band. - Fol. 125vb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 130va: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 136rb: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 138rb: Coloured ornamental band with a chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons beneath. - Fol. 144ra: Chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons. - Fol. 146vb: Coloured ornamental band.
